item.title: Courses
item.description: Notes of some courses I took at Uwaterloo and GaTech.

item.title: About
item.description: I am a first-year Operation Research PhD student at ISyE, Georgia Institute of Technology. Currently I am working with Diego Cifuentes and Alejandro Toriello. My research interests mainly lie in semidefinite programming and its applications to continuous optimization and combinatorial optimization. I obtained my MMATH in Combinatorics and Optimization from the University of Waterloo, under the supervision of Levent Tuncel. My research included the decomposition of positive semidefinite matrices into the sum of a low-rank and a sparse matrix.

item.title: New Web
item.description: Deploying a website with Hugo and Github. I have just switched from Jekyll and a theme called Xixia to Hugo recently. Hugo is just simple, clean and having a larger community. However I did spend some time on deploying my webpage on Github, which was supposed to be really easy. The instruction here gives a way to deploy your web but ONLY with the repository name. For example, It makes my GitHub page look like run-gong-0791.
